N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 8.4 - Effects of waiver of road test

State Regulations
(a) Classroom driver training
requirements. If a road test is waived upon application for an original
license, the applicant shall not be considered a new driver within the meaning
of section
7.2
(a) of this

Title and will not be required to submit proof of satisfactory completion of
not less than four hours and not more than five hours of classroom driver
training prior to the issuance of a license, except that an applicant who is
required to take a road test only because of age shall be considered to have a
road test waived for the purposes of Part 7 of this Title. (b) Probationary licensing. Except where a road test has been waived under the
provisions of section
8.2
(b) of this

Part, a license which has been issued after a waiver of a road test as provided
in this section shall not be a probationary license under subdivision (4) of
section
501
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Notes
